name: ft-concept-button
description: ft concept button (includes the ft follow button)

name: g-audio
description: IG audio player component

name: n-notification
description: Component for showing notifications to users

name: o-audio
description: Financial Times audio player

name: o-autocomplete
description: An origami component for autocomplete inputs

name: o-banner
description: Provides styling for product messaging which could include feature promotion, education, feedback, and legal information.

name: o-big-number
description: Typographical styles to highlight a big number.

name: o-buttons
description: FT buttons styles. Provides customisation options with the FT colour palette.

name: o-colors
description: The default colour palette for all FT products. The palette supports colour contrast checking, colour mixing and toneing.

name: o-comments
description: A component, integrated with FT authentication and user data services, to add a comment stream or comment count to content.

name: o-cookie-message
description: The cookie message and behaviour approved by the FT's legal team. All FT websites must have a cookie message. Using o-cookie-message will ensure your site is compliant according to EU regulatory law.

name: o-date
description: JavaScript utilities for formatting and updating dates in the FT style. Also useful for formatting dates relative to the current time.

name: o-editorial-layout
description: Layout for editorial content. Including margins for editorial typography.

name: o-editorial-typography
description: Typography styles for editorial content.

name: o-expander
description: Content-aware helper for expanding and collapsing content or lists.

name: o-fonts
description: Loads CSS declarations for FT web fonts. Does not include font assets.

name: o-footer
description: Responsive footer for all FT.com pages. Includes legally approved links.

name: o-footer-services
description: This is a legally approved footer component for internal products, tooling and customer products

name: o-forms
description: This component provides responsive styling for form fields and inputs. It provides validation and error handling for forms, as well.

name: o-ft-affiliate-ribbon
description: A ribbon denoting affiliation with the FT. This ribbon should be used in products that are owned by the Financial Times but have a separate brand identity to the company.

name: o-grid
description: A 12 column responsive, flexbox-based grid system for laying out documents, templates and components.

name: o-header
description: Responsive Financial Times page header with primary and secondary navigation, a drop down mega menu, and a collapsible drawer

name: o-header-services
description: Responsive page header for sites with minimal or customised branding, including internal products, customer facing tools, and specialist titles.

name: o-icons
description: Helper SCSS tool for using the FT's icons. For a full list of available icons please see the fticons image set

name: o-labels
description: Labels for content classification or to emphasise a value. Provides customisation options with the FT colour palette.

name: o-layout
description: Provides page layouts and typography as a starting point to create internal tools or products.

name: o-lazy-load
description: Provides lazy loading functionality for images, pictures, iframes, and more. It is powered by the Intersection Observer API to detect when the visibility of elements changes.

name: o-loading
description: A visual loading indicator, available in two colours and four sizes

name: o-message
description: Provides message elements for alerting, informing or making calls to action.

name: o-meter
description: Provides customization for meter tag

name: o-normalise
description: Provides base styles and resets for stylesheets. Includes standardised utilities, such as visually hiding components or adding a consistent focus state.

name: o-overlay
description: Configurable custom overlay box that can be used to show overlay windows. The overlays can also be switched to display differently on small screens

name: o-quote
description: Styling for blockquotes, pull-quotes and any other types of quote

name: o-share
description: Provides styling for social media sharing links

name: o-social-follow
description: Provides styling for social media sharing links

name: o-spacing
description: Maintain consistent spaces across components and projects in accordance to our baseline grid and design guidelines.

name: o-stepped-progress
description: Track progress through a multi-step process, such as a form

name: o-subs-card
description: A card for showing different subscription packages offered by the Financial Times

name: o-syntax-highlight
description: A syntax highlighter for Origami-supported documentation that wraps PrismJs

name: o-table
description: Provides styling and behvaiour for tables across FT products.

name: o-tabs
description: Tabs component for dividing content into meaningful sections.

name: o-teaser
description: Provides styling for teaser elements, which contain information about an article and link through to it

name: o-teaser-collection
description: Provides styles to layout out multiple teasers in one section.

name: o-toggle
description: Utility that provides toggle (show/hide) behaviour to a <button> or <a> tag and a target.

name: o-tooltip
description: Provides a viewport-aware tooltip for annotating or or highlighting other aspects of a product's UI

name: o-topper
description: Article header styling

name: o-typography
description: Typographical styles for FT branded sites. Including typographical fundamentals such as font scales, vertical rhythm, and font fallbacks; plus styles for UI including links, headings, and titles. Other components build on o-typography to provide for more specific usecases.

name: o-video
description: Creates a video player and attaches analytics. Also supports pre roll ads.

name: o-viewport
description: Utility for attaching debounced listeners to resize, scroll, orientation and visibility events on window

name: o-visual-effects
description: Provides visual effects through SCSS mixins, such as shadows and animations
